qas.question: What was done for the anniversary?
Where did the government open access to?

answers.text: the sealed ruins of the Beichuan county seat

qas.question: How long was it opened for?
What did China do to mark the first anniversary of the quake?
What will the Beichuan county seat be used for?
What kind of event were given to raise money for quake survivors?
What is the Beichuan museum meant to remind people of?

context: On May 12, 2009, China marked the first anniversary of the quake with <a0_0><a3_0>a moment of silence<a3_0/><a0_0/> as people across the nation remembered the dead. The government also opened access to <a1_0>the sealed ruins of the Beichuan county seat<a1_0/> for <a2_0>three days<a2_0/>, after which it will be frozen in time as a state <a4_0>earthquake relic museum<a4_0/>, to remind people of <a6_0>the terrible disaster<a6_0/>. There were also <a5_0>several concerts<a5_0/> across the country to raise money for the survivors of the quake.
